@graph.d3f:definition: Issue a new credential to a user which supercedes their old credential.
@graph.rdfs:label: Reissue Credential

@graph.d3f:definition: Restoring an entity's access to resources.
@graph.rdfs:label: Restore Access

@graph.d3f:definition: Restoring the data in a database.
@graph.rdfs:label: Restore Database

@graph.d3f:definition: Restoring a previously captured disk image a hard drive.
@graph.rdfs:label: Restore Disk Image

@graph.d3f:definition: Restoring an email for an entity to access.
@graph.rdfs:label: Restore Email

@graph.d3f:definition: Restoring a file for an entity to access.
@graph.rdfs:label: Restore File

@graph.d3f:definition: Restoring a entity's access to a computer network.
@graph.rdfs:label: Restore Network Access

@graph.d3f:definition: Restoring an object for an entity to access. This is the broadest class for object restoral.
@graph.rdfs:label: Restore Object

@graph.d3f:definition: Restoring a user account's access to resources.
@graph.rdfs:label: Restore User Account Access

@graph.d3f:definition: Restoring a user account's access to resources by unlocking a locked User Account.
@graph.rdfs:label: Unlock Account

@graph.d3f:definition: The restore tactic is used to return the system to a better state.
@graph.rdfs:label: Restore
